titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 350: L'introduttione di Pietro Magno nell' antica republica Romana

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 350: L'introduttione di Pietro Magno nell' antica republica Romana are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Edges and spine of cover show wear. Many leaves stained, especially at outer edge.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Account of the history of the Roman Republic, by Pietro Magno. Dedicated to Cardinal di Gambara at Rome, 20 December 1571 (f. 4v); preface addressed to Don Ottavio Carafa. An edition of this work was published in Rome in 1606 by L. Zannetti, edited by Ambrosio Lisci.

msItem.title: L'introduttione di Pietro Magno nell' antica republica Romana

supportDesc.extent: 123 leaves : 274 x 200 (188 x 133) mm bound to 280 x 205 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (modern paper) + 123 + i (modern paper); [1-123]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by a single hand; another hand appears responsible for the pen trials (with content related to Roman history) on the last leaf (f. 123v).

origin.p: Written in Italy, probably in the early 17th century (Zacour-Hirsch date of early 16th century is incorrect).

history.provenance: Sold by Luigi Gonnelli & Figli (Florence?, Italy), 1954.
